name: Pamella Stearns
text: The best! If they had a 10 star rating is give him exactly that. He really cares about you.

name: M Stevens
text: Really great doctor and friendly staff. Modern super clean waiting room with clean restrooms. Easy access off Frederick Rd or Corporate Dr.

name: Shari Carter
text: I LOVE Dr. Weeks...I felt I was going blind. It was cataracs!!! He operated on both and now I DO NOT need glasses. He is amazing, he gave me back my sight! Thank you for your compassion, caring and loving care. I am 69 and glass FREE! <3 (((hugs)))

name: RHONDA Cauthen
text: Thank Dr. Weeks for taking such good care of my grandson over the last 5 yrs. His case was rare and you were so very helpful, you saved his eye.

name: Carol Rattan
text: Love the new doctor and the staff! Dr. Gannon took time to answer my questions without rushing through the appointment.  So glad she comes to Wetumpka!

resp.text: Carol, thank you so much! We’re so excited to hear that you had such a wonderful experience with Dr. Gannon and our staff in Wetumpka, and that you didn’t feel rushed during your visit. Thank you again for taking the time to let us know how we did!

name: George walker
text: Very complete examination and evaluation. Dr Gannon is friendly and professional, her staff is well trained and friendly as well.

text: After cataract surgeries both eyes are seeing well with the new contacts,Thanks David.

resp.text: David, we’re so glad to hear that you’re pleased with the results of your cataract surgeries! Thanks so much for sharing this with us, and we truly hope you enjoyed your improved vision!

name: Teri Going
text: The doctor and staff were great.

resp.text: Hi Teri, thank you so much for the 5-star review! We are thrilled that our Wetumpka eye doctor and staff were able to help. It's our goal to continue to provide friendly and professional eye care!

name: AL Long
text:
Unprofessional and rude.
It took 2 hours just for a consultation! I arrived 15 minutes before my appointment with my paperwork already filled out. I waited in a small waiting room with no space between  chairs. When I was finally taken back I had to wait again because none of my info had been entered from the paperwork I brought when I arrived early. This took a while, but when completed, a different tech took me to a different section to check my eyes. She was rude and acted as though I was an inconvenience to her. I finally asked at one point how much longer it would be before I saw the Dr since I had to go back to work. She said it wouldn't be long and she would check on me in 5 minutes after she sent me back to the bright and packed waiting room with no eye protection after dilating my eyes.  About 30 minutes passed and she finally takes me back to another room. I ask again how long it will be because I HAVE to go back to work. She didn't like that but told me he would be in soon. He finally comes in the room and is in there less than 5 minutes to tell me I'm a candidate for lasik. I was also told that I would have to travel to their Columbus office for the surgery because the operating room there wasn't finished.
My wait was never acknowledged so of course I never received an apology for the 2 hours it took for a simple consultation. And the whole time I was waiting, the Dr was walking back and forth through the lobby as though he had nothing else to do.
Not impressed.

name: alfonzo murray
text:
Hororable appointment,no social distancing,more than one person in very small test rooms.
When I saw doctor he didn’t have mask on and tried too diagnose my condition.
I told him I was uncomfortable with him not wearing mask he had an off the wall excuse for not wearing one.
I asked if it was protocol for not wearing mask I got no answer.
So ended my appointment then and walked out the door..

name: Michael Minor
text: Used this business for 4 years & my fiance broke her glasses recently so I sent her over. Complete disaster of a visit....Was there for a simple eye exam & glasses. The Surgeon pushed Lasik & even made her an appointment for Lasik @ the Columbus location. Not what she was there for at all. The concern for patients is more or less a concern for Money. Lost her business as well as mine today. Couldn't even provide her with disposable protective sunglasses after dilating her eyes before they got her out the door...I MEAN COME ON.

name: Daniel Stevens
text: Amazing place to go to! I highly recommend. All of the staff are great, welcoming, and personable! They did an amazing job with my surgery and made sure everything went well! You will not go wrong with this place

resp.text:
Hi Daniel,
Glad you are happy with your procedure. We  appreciate the positive review. Thank you!

name: Randall Ferguson
text: Everyone was friendly, Nice and Professional! They have and open clean enviroment you can't go wrong with these guy's!

name: Melissa Heard
text: The DOCTORS ARE "EXCELLENT" They explain everything that is going on and the "DOCTORS" are very informative!!!!

name: Jason Thomas
text: Great doctor, friendly staff

name: Lisa Simmons
text: Super unprofessional staff from step 1 -- I called about making an appointment during posted business hours and was told no one was there to schedule that appointment because they "all left early today" so no one could help me.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. We appreciate all feedback. This is certainly not how we expect our patients to be assisted. Give us the opportunity to make a superb second impression.

name: Linda Paajanen
text: I can not say enough good things about Dr. Foster and his team.  I had the cataract surgery on both eyes.  My eyesight has been really really bad my whole life. It's like a miracle that I can see without glasses or contacts.  I can now see how to walk in the morning when I wake. Dr Foster is the best.  I recommend him to everyone who needs eye care.  Thank you again Dr. Foster.

name: Dennis Bulgatz
text: I am a "young" cataract patient at 55, when the average age is 75.  I was pretty nervous about the procedure, though I clearly needed it.  Dr. Stephens was an awesome surgeon, and my result was a pain-free, 20/20, with little fuss.  The office runs like a factory, which can be a little off-putting, but is very efficient, and everyone was very nice- you just do not get a lot of time with your doctor.  I commend the office and Dr. Stephens for running a great practice.

name: JP Tribble
text: If you have a problem, let them know, and the practice manager, Tammy, should be able to help.

resp.text: Hello, it is always difficult to hear about a bad experience in our office as we are committed to providing our patients with the best possible care. We take these reviews and patient feedback seriously. Due to HIPAA regulations, we can’t discuss the specifics about your comments online, but if you call our office at 256-705-3937 we will be happy to address any concerns.

name: Kayla Eckhardt
text: This place is amazing & they are so sweet & well respected & caring for their patients. Doctor Calderwood has done amazing work with my eyes. She has changed my life & gave me more confidence in myself. My EYES are perfect 👌

name: Byron Brown
text: I really like the Doctors in this practice.  They are very thorough and explain what is necessary to  know.  I feel the Doctors especially Dr. Frederick.  However, the front office staff are the cockiest, curt, and far from friendly as any doctor's office in Huntsville.  Makes me want to find a new Doctor just because of the rude office staff.

resp.text: Hello, it is always difficult to hear about a bad experience in our office as we are committed to providing our patients with the best possible care. name: Kelly
text: My teenage son & I are both new patients here after having been patients at another practice in Huntsville. We changed to this practice because of negative experiences with contact fittings & education for my son and incorrect glasses for myself at the previous place. We truly love this office and the staff who have helped us. Denise Baldwin, COA, Contact Lens Specialist, in this office was incredible with my teenager! He has never had contacts before and she was very patient and kind with teaching him how to wear and take care of contacts. Our previous office was not so at all. We have had to wait a bit once or twice but not for too terribly long. (Most medical offices in Huntsville have a bit of a wait anyway because we're in need of more physicians.) But our brief wait here was definitely worth it due to the excellent care we received. The physician was quick & efficient, answered all of our questions, and wasted none of our time once we got to him. The front desk staff, although super busy and quite overwhelmed with taking temps and addressing non mask-wearing patients, stayed professional and kind and so did the employee at the checkout desk. We will absolutely continue to be patients here. As a nurse myself I am very particular about my family's and my medical office experiences so if I give a place a 5 star I really mean it.

name: Lynn Sparks
text: Dr. Hubickey's staff were so friendly and professional especially during these difficult times.  All were knowledgeable and could answer any question.  The thoroughness taken to determine which procedure was best for me was extensive and my appreciation for going above and beyond to help me make my decision for what was best for me.  Everything explained before, during and after the procedure was spot on so I knew what to expect.  I'm so thankful that I can see without the aid of glasses or contacts.  I just wish I had done it sooner.  Thanks Dr. Hubickey and Staff!!!!!!!

name: Lori Hall
text: Fantastic service from everyone I have ever encountered here. I’ve had cataract surgery by Dr. Derivaux and Lasek by Dr. Hubickey. I couldn’t see 1 foot in front of my face beforehand, and now after both surgeries, I do not need glasses for my near-sightedness. It has been a life-changing experience; hard to put into words. I would recommend both doctors 100%. My son recently had Dr. Hubickey perform his Lasek surgery as well, and my son is nothing short of amazed as well. Phenomenal, professional place.

name: Mary Moore
text: No stars people and staff hateful did not have time for me had to go back twice glasses still not right and after all of that they losted my co pay and telling me I need to pay the co pay again no way and the optical center made my glasses worng there mistake and I had to pay more money to fix them will never never never go back 😔

name: Scott Moss
text: The Doctors are great, the running of the office is a one star. Wife had to wait about an hour and 10 minutes past her appointment time. A person an HOUR late for their appointment was put ahead of her. Don't bother with contacts here, they are ridiculous. I would only recommend this place for eye emergencies or medical issues of the eye. Not any kind of eyeglasses or contacts. Going here though makes me feeling young and in great health.

name: Pamela Whitman
text: I am so glad I discovered The Eye Center!  I had been going to Birmingham to see an ophthalmologist for several years that I had been referred to by a now defunct optometrist office. That ophthalmologist just was bilking my Blue Cross and Blue Shield and my vision insurance.  I made an appointment with The Eye Center and was quickly seen by Dr. Frederick who scheduled back to back cataract surgeries and now I only need readers for reading small print.  After all my years of wearing glasses I love being able to just wear  regular sunglasses and OTC readers when I need them!

name: Michele Comisky
text: Great practice!  Very organized and friendly. Dr. Hubicky is a very skilled surgeon. He does an excellent Lasik procedure and I highly recommend.

name: Derek Huff
text: The staff is super friendly and thorough.  Dr. Foster is very knowledgeable and attentive.  They take great care of my eyes and have my glaucoma under control.  Would definitely recommend to anyone needing professional and courteous care.

name: Paula Kraft
text: Before I started working for The Eye Center my daughter was a patient of Dr. Malone since she was about 13 months now she is 13. Have always been professional and answered any concerns I may have had. When she needed to get in the staff was quick to set us up a appointment.Now that I have started working for TEC everyone has been welcoming and so friendly. They care about their patients and the staff. All of the Dr's are friendly and professional so you can't make a wrong choice when deciding who you want to see for your eye care.

name: Kristie Smith
text: My son was denied medical care due to him having a both a newborn sibling and a toddler sibling in which the office will not allow to come in due to the “coronavirus”.  I explained to them that we don’t not have any family that are able to keep the siblings while we attend the appointment.  I was told my son would not be allowed to come if the siblings came.  If masks work and we all live in the same household then what is the problem?  No child should be denied medical care under any circumstance.

text: I’ve been going here for years. Glasses, contacts and most recently Lasek surgery. I’ve always had a great experience. Dr. Hubickey is fantastic!

name: Justin Nicholson
text: The Eye Center has amazing doctors and staff. Very thorough exams and everyone I encountered was kind and knowledgeable. Would definitely recommend this office for any of your eye care needs.

name: Thomas Benn
text: I was very pleased with the care that I received from the staff and physicians at They Eye Center. The outcome resulting from the treatment plan has been spectacular! I also appreciate the attention given to safety and prevention during the pandemic.

name: Ashley Michelle
text: I had LASEK back in January and it was the best money I have ever spent. I was "a little difficult" and had only a couple of days to get the procedure done due to work, but Dr. Hubickey and his staff (April to name one) were so awesome and did the surgery a couple days after my evaluation.  When I say it was painless, it was!! I had a good recovery too. I also had to call April late one night for eye drops and she did not seem annoyed about the hour that the phone call came in. I never waited more than 15 minutes in the waiting room so I can not agree with the other comments. If you are thinking about getting Lasik, PRK, LASEK, or any other eye procedure done, I highly recommend them!

name: John Bearden
text:
Regarding Dr Hubicky, scroll down. he is an awesome doctor. We did have a little episode regarding my time sitting too long in the waiting room. .. I left. The next morning, a very sweet lady, Tammy Cantrell called, apologized, and explained that a storm had caused a server to go down resulting in equipment not working. By the way: I am very happy with my vision.
Dr. Hubickey was an instrument in the hand of The Lord that changed my life. 1. I had a reoccurring corneal erosion for 2 years.. that was painful and basically killing me because I couldn't sleep. 2. I was near sighted in both eyes. about -3.0 in contact lenses.
Dr. Hubickey did PRK on both eyes. I no longer have corneal erosion and I see really well.
In addition, April, Katelyn, and others were very professional and helpful. The only regret is that I waited so long to do it.

text: Overall the care is extremely thorough. They have the ability to take care of all of my eye care needs and strive to give the best care possible.

text: I love this place. It’s completely worth being dilated for! From pediatrics to eye diseases to LASIK, they will go above and beyond to take care of your eyes! Everyone is so friendly, it is a GREAT experience! Can’t wait for my next eye exam🖤

name: Caroline Hoover
text: The Eye Center is absolutely the best place in North Alabama for eye care.  The doctors are ALL wonderful at what they do and they treat every patient with kindness and compassion and give each of them a thorough examination and give them as much time as they need.  The technicians are all so kind and respectful to their patients, as well as proficient and knowledgeable at their jobs.  I recommend The Eye Center to anyone who is having any kind of problem with their eyes or their vision.

name: Karen Duke
text: The welcoming lobby with friendly employees is a good start and gets better. The tech/nurses are very efficient and Dr Stevens is terrific, ready to answer all questions. Excellent experience with only a short wait!

name: Jessica Lastname
text: The staff was friendly and nice. I hardly had to wait for my contact or eye exam. Since I went during Covid, everyone had masks on (staff and patients).

name: Kara Woosley
text: There are not enough wonderful things I could say about Dr.Hubickey and his staff! They were all so educated,  patient, knowledgable and helpful for every question I had and every part of my consultation and also surgery ! I would highly reccomend him to anyone considering Lasik eye surgery with no hesitation!

name: Linda Haybarker
text: The Eye Center is amazing! This great group of doctors and staff really care about their patients and provide excellent care for your eyes. I have had appointments with several of the doctors and each appointment was thorough and all my questions were answered.

name: cassandra broadway
text: All of the doctors here are the best. They treat their patients with the best care and treatment possible. Considering how busy they are, the staff is quick and very efficient. I highly recommend any and all of the doctors here.

name: Tonio Koger
text: The family environment here is beyond amazing...to be employed by those that truly care is such a blessing!!

name: Shaina Deal
text: The Eye Center is a wonderful place for any eye care needs, these doctors have a fantastic reputation throughout North Alabama and it is well deserved. They are compassionate and thoughtful and the staff is all very polite and kind! I wouldn't hesitate to refer anyone to The Eye Center, my whole family goes there!

name: Linsey Woods
text: Alex was wonderful and timely. The exam seems to be extensive which is good. The only downfall for pediatrics is the extensive wait periods and going in and out of the waiting room multiple times, up and downstairs for different testing then being put at the back of the line again once arriving back from testing.  Children do not tolerate excessive wait times very well. Outside of that part seeming very unorganized, it seems to be a thorough exam. Just be prepared to be there for several plus hours would be advice I wished someone had informed me of.

name: Lelah Patterson
text: Such a positive environment from all the staff! The doctors are knowledgeable, thorough and always willing to answer any questions. The Eye Center sets a high standard for patient care!

name: Meagan Brisendine
text: The doctors are nice and personable! The staff through out the entire office are sweet and will help you in any way they can! I recommend The Eye Center to anyone that is having any kind of vision problems!

text: The Doctors at The Eye Center are the best!  So much experience and expertise in one practice.  I highly recommend The Eye Center physicians, the Optical Shop and Contact Lens Department

text: Very friendly staff and great doctors. I didn’t feel rushed and all of my concerns were addressed!

name: Amber Jones
text: The Eye Center is an amazing practice.  From the moment you call to make the appointment, thru the entire appointment with the staff and Physicians, and then to check out, It is a wonderful experience. Everyone is nice and very knowledgeable.

name: Abby Cantrell
text: I recently had the most comprehensive eye exam by Dr. Foster! One of the things that impressed me most about the Eye Center was how kind the people were and I feel like I was in really great hands during my entire visit!

All the physicians are great to work with and treat their patients with compassion and kindness and give the best care and treatment possible. I am proud to be a part of such a great group. Dr.Hubickey is a amazing Lasik surgeon!!!

name: Jackie Earhart
text: I love the eye center. The staff are wonderful and the doctors are top notch!

name: Lonzo Robinson
text: I went to the Madison Office yesterday.  The staff was both friendly and professional.  I went early so there was no wait.  And Dr. Frederick was organized, methodical, and efficient.  He explained the issues and made suggestions to solutions.  Highly recommend.

resp.text: Lonzo, thank you for the 5 star review and kind words! We greatly appreciate you taking the time to leave a response.

name: Don Coplen
text:
I've been going to Dr.Stevens for several years for my glaucoma. The doctor is brilliant! Very professional. It's hard to imagine that I could ever find a better person to manage my vision issues. If I ever do have to find a new glaucoma specialist, I pity that person, because he/she will have some difficult shoes to fill.

As to some reviews complaining about waits. The waiting time varies, depending on the time of day and the patient load for the day. I have never felt rushed by Dr.Stevens, and that's more important to me than shorter waits in the reception area if those are my two choices. I try to schedule early as possible, which normally results in the shortest waits. This is often true of ANY doctor appointment.

resp.text: Don, thank you so much for taking the time to leave a review! We appreciate your positive feedback!

name: Lindsay Healy
text: I had LASEK surgery with Dr. Hubickey several years ago and it was the best decision ever. I was very nearsighted and my poor vision is a distant memory! Dr. Hubickey is a very thorough physician and takes his time to make sure all the testing meets his high standards. Staff is great too!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words!

name: Donna Patterson
text: The staff is very very unfriendly. No smiles. No hellos. No how is your day after surgery. NOTHING. you're a piece of paper and eyes and that's it.  Been multiple times and never a smile all frowns.😒

resp.text: Hi Donna - We appreciate you coming back and visiting us and are so sorry to hear about your experience. At The Eye Center we want you to feel like family and we apologize for you feeling anything other than that! Thank you for your feedback.

name: Elizabeth Broadway
text: The staff is so friendly and helpful. The doctors are professional and thorough when giving exams and listen to you when you have concerns.

name: Heather Phillips
text: I've been here three times with my young children. There is always a very, very long wait. They schedule multiple appointments per appointment time. Today I waited 40 minutes in the front lobby and walked out because I was tired of waiting. Waiting is hard for little kids and babies and my time is valuable. I will not be back.

resp.text: Hi Heather - I am sorry to hear about your experience with us. We are constantly working on providing the highest quality of service and appreciate your feedback.

name: Dan Chitwood
text:
They may do a good job, but after waiting an hour after my appointment time, I will never know. There was no communication from the front office staff that they were running behind...in fact they left for the day while I was waiting.
If you're running behind schedule, then inform your patients before they arrive. My time is my most valuable resource and The Eye Center wasted it.

resp.text: Hi Dan - I am sorry to hear about the scheduling and communication issues that arose while you were waiting. We do value your time and apologize for any inconveniences we might have caused you. We are constantly working on providing the highest quality of service and appreciate your feedback.

name: Scott Cantrell
text: Great people that really care about helping their patients!

name: Amanda Simpson
text: Great place to work.

name: Chrina Serrant
text: The staff are very nice and great with kids but the wait is awful especially when you show up early for your appointment an still your in the waiting room for an extra 45 mins to an hour. Like if your appointment is 2:00 be prepared to be called back about 30-45 later, which if your an on time person it wouldn't make sense to show up early cause you will not get seen on time. It's not fair when you show up on time an you have to wait, then once you get called back it's another waiting game an you wait forever an forever. If you have an appointment here don't have nothing else to do or have to pick anyone else up from work cause you won't get out on time. Especially with a small child they get very restless an irritated, an when they come in to see about your child your child isn't cooperating cause they have waited so long they are tired. Other than that the staff is friendly.

resp.text:
Hi Chrina,

Thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We are always looking to improve our processes and provide the best possible care to our patients. We value all feedback and will take the steps needed to address these concerns.

name: Robert Moore
text: I have heard good things about Dr Diveraux. The staff however was unfriendly & arrogant. They take digital photos of all patients for "their charts". I don't enjoy visiting the DMV & am not about to trust an establishment with the customer no service displayed here.

resp.text: Hi Robert - I am so sorry to hear about your experience with us. At The Eye Center we always strive to provide the best quality customer service, but we aren't always perfect. Thank you for your feedback.

name: roger curry
text: the eye center charged me 35 bucks when I lost my glasses to get a copy of my prescription. They pretty much suck and hope everyone sees this review.

resp.text: It is always difficult to hear about a bad experience in our office as we are committed to providing our patients with the best possible care. We take these reviews and patient feedback seriously. Due to HIPAA regulations, we can’t discuss the specifics about your comments online, but if you call our office at 256-705-3937 we will be happy to address any concerns.

text: Don’t make any other plans after your appt. The wait is ridiculous. I understand being busy but 2.5 hours for one appt is absurd. Everyone’s time is valuable not just Doctors.

text: Great doctors and professional staff!

name: Queen B
text: This was by far the worst experience my husband or I have ever had at a clinic. We were forwarded here by our pediatrician and i called a month and a half ahead to make our appointment. Our appointment was scheduled for 3:15pm and I showed up at 2:45pm to complete all of the neccessary paperwork. My husband and two kids, 3years and 10months showed up at 3:15. We waited and waited and waited. We were not seen until 4:30 (now mind you their office closes at 5pm). However I constantly see the doctor and her nurses talking and giggling at a computer in the hallway. So after finally being called in the nurse does some little eye tests and dialates my sons eyes. While waiting i spoke with another mother that said her duaghter was there for her appointment at that was at 4pm. We are then sent out to the waiting room and wait another 20min for them to pull us into the room to see the Doctor. So after being called into the room we again waited and waited and waited. We sait in there for 45MIN!!!! Now it is 5:45pm and my two children are hungry, tired and are frustrated at having to look at walls. So we finally looked out of the room to find out that the ENTIRE Office Staff had left and the doctor was in another room with the little girl whose appointment was at 4pm which was after my son's. When the Doctor FINALLY made her appearance she said my son was fine and we could go!!! 3 HOURS to tell us he was fine! Now mind you on the paper work they sent it said to prepare for a 30min appointment! This was by far the WORST experience we have EVER had and will NEVER return! This Staff does not care for its patients or what they have going on and only want your money and to waste your time! If I could rate them NEGATIVE stars I would!

resp.text: Hi RB - I am sorry to hear about your experience with us. We apologize the the time delay while you were visiting us. Thank you for your feedback.

name: Ellen Cozelos
text:
I expect to have a long wait with a doctors' appointment occasionally, emergencies happen.  But this is an eye doctors' clinic!!  How many life or death situations can happen there?   Our appointment was set for 2:30, finally got out  after 5 p.m.!  Talked with other people waiting, 2 to 3 hours is the norm here....less than 5 minutes with the actual doctor.  Luckily, most doctors' offices no longer practice the the art of over booking like they do here.  Donna Patterson nailed it by stating that to the people of the Eye Center, you are only a piece of paper with eyes (or ears)

Update:  Again they apologize, yet the complaints keep coming in for the same issues.  Me thinks the "apologies sound a bit hollow"

resp.text: Hi Ellen - We apologize for your bad experience with us and for the inconvenience your wait may have caused. At The Eye Center, we strive to give you the best customer service and are always striving to do better. Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback.

name: Paul Jackson
text: The staff was friendly and Dr. Elkins was personable and knowledgeable.  However, they added a lot of extra things to the lenses that ran the price way up.  When I got the glasses, they had the prescription wrong.  I took them back and they were going to redo them.  I told them how the close up prescription needed to be adjusted but they said it would be too much and ordered them like they wanted.  I called when I hadn't heard in a couple weeks and they had forgotten to send them off.    When they came in, it was just the lenses and no frames.  They didn't have the frames in stock so they would have to order them.  I live two hours from the office and didn't want to make yet another trip so they said they would mail them to me.  When I got them today, they should have listened to me as the focal point is still too close.  I've had five interactions with them and have been dissatisfied with all five.  They are very nice, but can't seem to get things done right.

resp.text: Paul, I'm Cassie. I'm so sorry to hear we haven't been able to get your glasses right for you yet! It's so frustrating when you've tried to communicate what you need and it hasn't been heard. I've passed your concerns on to our management team and they would like to reach out to you -- when you have a moment, could you please email me at cassiegoodwin@eyecare-partners.com? Again, I'm so sorry to hear about dropping the ball for you. I hope to hear from you soon.

name: Brenda Massey
text:
I went to this Dr.   About 2 years ago. My glasses were like 500.00 with insurance. I thought that was way to much. Well went back for ck up. 2 years later. I was told I had
Over paid last time by 150.00 . So  I ordered more glasses.  Well I changed my mind. And told them to cancel the order. Mind u it was like 30 min. Later. They told me the could not refund my money for 2 weeks. Well 2 weeks later I got the 150.00 they owned me FOR 2 YEARS WITH OUT INTEREST.  and its been about 6 weeks and still the 170.00 has not ben sent to me. DON'T GO TO THESES PEOPLE THEY WILL TAKE YOU MONEY. AND NOT GIVE IT BACK.  I'VE CALLED THEM EVERY 2 WEEKS AND STILL NO MONEY. I'VE NEVER HAD A DR. KEEP OVER PAYMENT.  FOR 2 YEARS. IF I OVER PAY. THE DR. WILL SEND IT AT THE END OF THE YEAR. WHEN THEY COLSE THE BOOKS FOR THE YEAR. SO U CAN'T TRUST THESE PEOPLE.  THE LADY CONTACTED ME AND TOLD ME THE HAD MONEY AND THEY WOULD SEND IT BACK WHEN THEY GOT AROUND TO IT .WOULD DON'T GIVE A DATE. ... SHE WAS VERY RUDE I TOLD HER I WOULD PUT IT ON THE POST IT . SHE SAID WE DON'T CARE.  DON'T GIVE THEM YOUR MONEY......

resp.text: Hi Brenda, my name is Katie. I am so sorry to hear about your experience at our office. I would like to forward this to management so it doesn't happen again. When you have a moment - please email me at kaitlyngibson@eyecare-partners.com. Again, I apologize and I look forward to hearing from you.

name: andrew burden
text: My visit with EyeCare Associates was very good . First Class services.

name: Steven McGill
text: All are amazing, caring, talented professionals! Plainly the best, period!

name: brian doyle
text: My recent purchase of two reading glasses and one pair of sunglasses was a surprising and most pleasant experience.  Ashley compared the two current promotions to find me the very best price.  Then, several days later, I received a call that my glasses had arrived, but Eyecare Associates had rejected them after inspection and had ordered a new fabrication.  Wow!  Just a few days after that, I went to pick up my new remakes.  I was not satisfied with the field of vision they offered, and Ashley showed me the three types of lenses available.   I selected a set with a broader field of vision and, in spite of the $80 increase each of the three sets would entail, placed my order.  The next day, Ashley called to tell me she had discussed my case with the manager, and they had decided to wave all further fees, so these three new pairs would be free!   Double-wow!   I was impressed and, frankly, touched by the empathy, attention, personal concern, and expert service I received from Eyecare Associates.    EA went out of their way and beyond all my expectations to insure a fair and positive experience for me, and I simply cannot recommend them enough!  Definitely be my go-to eye care specialists from now on.

name: therainman 23
text: I really enjoyed my visit. I felt comfortable and the customer service was amazing. V was very friendly and informative also the Doctor was extremely thorough and took his time examining my eyes. I will definitely recommend EyeCare Associates to friends and Family.

text: Doctor Elkins and staff are welcoming, very helpful, and kind! We had a great overall experience from beginning to end. Thank you so much!

name: Dianne Miller
text:
Due to a series of mistakes, I found myself in Daphne AL with no contacts, eye glasses, and an empty  right eye of the necessary contact.  I have terrible eyesight with my right eye being a -8.50. It is very difficult to find any eye MD who has this contact in stock.  Note this is the Friday before 2018 New Year and have to drive back to ATLANTA GA.  Called my home eye MD, who is part of the EyeCare network. They suggested I try contacting EyeCare Associates in the area.  This recommendation led me here.

Ashley, in Dr. Glusman's office, was so helpful, pleasant, & professional.  They saved my life by having in stock a -8.50 contact!!  If I lived in this area, I would definitely make this EyeCare center my home for all my eye needs.  I am so grateful for their assistance.  Thank you, thank you!

text: frauds.  The eye doctor is great, but they are yet another medical company taking advantage of people that have insurance.  if you pay case the over priced glass frames are 50% off. if you have insurance you have to pay $350 or more for frames then after you insurance allowance you end up paying the same amount as someone with out insurance. its unethical and they should be shut down or penalized for this.  do not go here.

Thanks

text: They are AMAZING!! I was so nervous to have the LASIK procedure done but they walked me through absolutely everything and were constantly reassuring. Best procedure experience ever. I can not recommend them enough!! Dr. McFaden and Dr. Shin are the best!

name: Graham McGalliard
text:
I’ve been to both Prattville and Sturbridge locations for exams with contacts and glasses in the past. I had LASIK April 22 performed by Dr. Swan and the results have been incredible. I could see drastically better leaving the office 10 minutes after. At my post-op appointment the next day I could see almost 20/15 out of one eye. The other eye does have more irritation and dryness and is improving daily.

Dr. McFaden and the rest of the staff have been very helpful and friendly getting my procedure set up and during recovery to help with the irritation and minor swelling.

I look forward to see how my eyes have healed at the 1 week follow-up. I highly recommend LASIK with Montgomery Eye Physicians. It’s been life-changing already.

name: Valerie Turner
text: I had to wait a long tome to see the doctor, over 2 hours.

name: LInda Johnson
text: Very good and friendly.

name: Jenny Griff
text: Took my brother with a disability to office saw Dr. Shin everything started smoothly until he started to examine him. He started yelling to look this way don't blink. I told the doctor he's not deaf and I'm translating no need to yell, well he needs to do want I'm asking. 🤨Really a person with down syndrome can't control the fact that he see's something coming at his eye. He was suppose to take a sample of whatever he had in his eye and the risk was if he moves or blink I could cut his eye. I call our mom and told her the risk and how this doctor acted towards my brother she was not happy nor was I we left but not before I told him that we would find someone that can have the patience and find a different way to do this procedure his response was well the other place you will find a specialist is in Bham and if you don't he will lose his eye. I told him don't worry I have driven to Bham before to take him to doctors and I will make sure he doesn't lose his eye unlike you.

name: Sonja Ethridge
text: Very friendly service and doctors will answer all your questions and give you just about all the information you need,  I especially liked that my doctor gave me sample eye drops to try and that I can get them over the counter or by prescription from my primary care provider.

name: Shemaiah Campbell
text: Most of seemed really nice. But, I came in March 3rd to order a contact lense. Dr. McFaden gave me a contact lense review. One had gotten broken 2 days beforeand. Dr. McFaden said it was ok to go ahead and order my lense now so I can have it on the way soon and if it needed to be changed they will do that on my regular schedule exam on March 13th. I was told by one of the nurses that the order for my contact was put in and there wasn't a payment for today and that they will call me when it came in. Forward to March 13th when it was time to have a regular full exam, I asked about the order, and then that's when I was told I had to make a full payment first before it was ordered. So what they told me the first time was a straight up LIE. My contact could've almost been here by now if they would've just told me that in first place!! Now I have to go with 1 freaking contact in for another 2 weeks because somebody don't know how to properly do their job!! This really pisses me off and Tiffany always have a rude demeanor.  My problem wasn't paying for the contact upfront! I could've done that March 3rd! It's the lie that I was told about the ordering! It's not fun going longer than what I have to with one contact!

name: Karen Harris
text: When I scheduled my new patient appointment almost 2 months ago, I was adamant that I wanted to be seen by an ophthalmologist.  An appointment was made to see Dr. Mitchell and to also see Dr. McFadden for my contact exam.  Fast forward to today, when I arrived for my appointment, I'm informed that it has been cancelled.  No phone call, text, email...NOTHING!  As a matter of fact, I had to call the week before to confirm my appointment  because I had not received any form of confirmation.  Needless to say, I will not return or recommend this practice to anyone.  I did not appreciate having my appointment cancelled without any just reason and then only to arrive and have the lady at the reception desk continuously trying to get me to see another doctor.

resp.text: Karen, we are sorry to hear about your experience today. We are looking into the issue now and will call you shortly to review. Thank you for the feedback.

name: Stephen Pierce
text: This is my second review.  Plan to spend more than one or two hours there.  The last visit took three hours.  The previous visit Dr. Swan was two and a half hours LATE for my apt.  Next time I will allow a thirty minute wait then leave!

name: Keith Smith
text: Dr. Mcfaden is a great doctor! Very thorough. Highly recommend him to anyone. The staff as a whole is awesome as well!

name: Brandon Stoudenmier
text: The staff was very accommodating over the course of multiple appointments, answered all of my questions, and went above and beyond to assist with LASIK. Greatly appreciated!

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback, Brandon! We appreciate you taking the time to let us know about your experience.

name: Misty Price
text: Friendly staff & short wait time. I had lasik surgery performed here & they did a fantastic job. They were friendly before, during, & after the surgery, which helped tremendously. If you are considering lasik, give them a visit!

name: Cherokee Haynes
text: Service was good but the receptionists were extremely rude and talking about people in front of their faces. Very disrespectful!

resp.text: Cherokee, thank you for sending us your feedback. We are sorry to hear we didn't exceed expectations during your visit. This information has been sent to our administrative team so we can make the proper adjustments. Your feedback is important to our practice, and we appreciate you taking the time to let us know about your experience.

name: Matthew Brown
text:
When I showed up for my new patient appointment I was told the Dr. had left sick. That's understandable, but no one could give me an explanation as to why I wasn't called and told this before my appointment time.  I drove across Montgomery just for this appointment.  I was told they would call me to reschedule in the morning. No one called.
I called them the next day and then I was put on hold and then hung up on.  It's very clear to me they don't need/want new patients. Moving on

name: Dick Martin
text: I had the occasion to have a glaucoma test by Dr Shin which was with a hand held paortable device. It happened to be 10 points higher than a test administered to me days earlier by Dr . Izer.  He wanted to prescribe medication. When I said I just had the test 4 days ago by another doctor, he got very upset and told me there is no reason for me to come back since I saw the other doctor. Apparently he doesn’t like a patient getting a second opinion. He is insecure or threatened by a second opinion, especially when there is such a disparity in the result.

name: Karl Smith
text: I had a difficult time trying to find this office even with the GPS feature on my cellphone

name: norris laurence
text: Very good! The staff were pleasant to deal with and were helpful. Dr. Jones did a good examination of  my eyes and vision which were reported as being good. There was no need for a change in eyeglasses.

name: Karen Viator

text: My husband and I both use Dr. Charles Jones.  He and his staff are always professional and answer any questions.  I thought my husband had to have a certain test due to a new medication; however, I misunderstood my husband's Doctor and one of the assistants in Dr. Jones Office, Valerie, took the time to come out and explain to me that since the Doctor decided on a different medication, that particular test was not necessary.  I was very grateful to Valerie for taking the time to do this.  She also suggested that my husband use an eye lubricant and not the eyedrops that he had been using as the lubricant was a healthier choice.

name: Carrie Blocker
text:
I was disappointed because we’d used them in the past and been satisfied with service. This transaction was not a good one, and we will not be returning.
Upon entering, we were met with grumpiness as if we were inconveniencing the staff. Coming in simply for a lens update, i anticipated an easy interaction. No one directed us and once we finally spoke with someone, she acted as if we should know the policies. We had to schedule an appointment to come back just to have lenses replaced. So i scheduled for their next open slot (almost a week later).
We were met with the same attitude upon our appointment and went through the whole process of ordering. As i was about to pay, we were informed that the glasses would have to be shipped out and so my daughter would not have glasses for the next 2 weeks. Unacceptable. I canceled the order and we left to seek better options elsewhere… which we found with smiles and a lower price tag.

resp.text: Carrie, I'm Cassie. I'm so sorry to hear about your experience getting glasses in our office -- that's definitely not what we want for you! I'd like to look into why this happened. Could you please email me at cassiegoodwin@eyecare-partners.com when you have a moment? Again, I'm very sorry about this. I hope to hear from you soon.

name: Christina Rose
text: Liz was the most AMAZING,calming, professional person I could've asked for. She did everything possible to make me comfortable and calm my anxiety I having about my eye issues. Dr Jackson did a great job explaining everything In detail and made me feel so much more at ease then when I walked in. Every fear I had about my eyes, he explained in detail why I shouldn't worry about them and that I was going to be ok. I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND. I now have myself and children as patients. ❤️

name: Mamie Douglas
text: Dr. Jackson has serviced my family and me, for more than 15 years. Dr. Jackson’s very patient and explain in detail of your eyes as it relates to your eye medical stance. I definitely recommend anyone who desires to have a great medical eye examine, Eyecare Associates’ best choice.

name: Dave Stever
text: I was welcomed when I entered the front door.  The medical technician, Regina, did an excellent job taking in all the information and adjusting the equipment before the doctor entered.  Dr. Harris examined me, informed me of any current or future problems, and made some slight corrections to my contact lens' prescription.  All in all, a very pleasant, professional visit.

name: Dyisha Lewis
text: I first visited Dr. Harris let February and that’s when I found out my retina had detached and he immediately reached out to one of his colleagues and I received the surgery immediately! It’s been a year and I went for a regular appointment with De. Harris and loved the visit! Nice atmosphere and they really care about their patients. I would definitely recommend them!

text: Dr. Jackson is the most amazing physician I have met. I am a nurse and I work with a lot of physicians. But what sets Dr. Jackson apart is that he cares about his patients and sympathizes with us. He teaches beyond just eyes. 🥰

text: They made us wait in the waiting room for an hour before finally bringing us to the room where we then sat for another hour. So by the time we had left we had been there for 2 1/2 hours. And I'm not really sure I trust the opinion of the Dr as some things he said didn't make sense.

text: The staff at EyeCare Associates is the best. Everyone there is super friendly, helpful, and personable. This is the only place I go for my eyes. Highly recommend.

text: They have all their COVID protocols worked out, so things progressed very smoothly.  No serious waiting involved.  Dr Harris was kind, courteous and always a pleasant conversationalist.  The texting of reminders prior to the appointment and the follow up afterwards were concise, well timed and with a light-touch.  After 15 years we still remain satisfied customers.  So, go check them out.

name: Heather Clark
text: I have been going to Dr. Harris for so many years.  They are always very clean and so very kind.  They are always ready to assist you in a timely manner.

name: salina coleman
text: Dr. Jackson and his nurse was Awesome!! The whole place was a pleasure to be in the midst of.

name: Emily S
text: Both my husband and I felt like we were just a commissions check to this office. The initial welcome from the receptionist was cold and annoyed. We spent 3 hours apiece here to get contacts (him) and glasses/contacts (me) and walked out spending far more than usual. Being a new patient from out of town I would have expected more of a consultation from the doctor before just throwing me into contacts. I was only able to wear each contact set for 2-3 hours before having to take them out because they were green. When I called the office to express my concern the only thing they said was to use contact solution not tap water. (Who does that anyways?! Tap water?) I’m sorry I’ve worn contacts before and have never had them turn green. So there’s a contact fitting co-pay wasted and not refunded. It’s been a solid 2 weeks since ordering my glasses (should have been 7-10 business days) I called twice to get an update and get transferred to a voicemail with no response (24-48 hours right?). When I went looking for new frames the person helping me knew my insurance budget and pulled frames almost double my budget rather than asking me what I felt comfortable spending. She also picked frames that were extremely outside of my current shape, style,  and comfort zone. All and all I probably will find a different office for us next year simply because the lack of care, communication, and consultation.

resp.text: Emily, I'm Cassie. I'm so sorry to hear about your experience in our office. It's so frustrating when you don't feel heard! We strive to provide excellent care for every patient, and we obviously fell short for you and your husband. I've spoken to our management team about your concerns and they would like to reach out to you. Could you please email me at cassiegoodwin@eyecare-partners.com when you have a moment? Again, I'm so sorry to hear about this. I hope to hear from you soon.

name: tom reinhardt
text: You all were extremely helpful especially the sweet women at the front desk as she could tell I was in pain and cared enough to stop what she was doing and get me some numbing eye drops and put them in for me to help sooth the pain it was such a relief and really a blessing knowing that there is still at least one practice that has caring and loving staff or employees that care about their patients and don't treat them as a number on a clip board! And that can mean a lot to a patient like myself! For me I lost my mother when I was 11 And when I came into EyeCare Associates they made me feel right at home like their on son and made me feel like I had two moms behind the front desk. :) Thank y’all for all of your help, care and concern! And I LOOK forward to seeing you all again soon! :)

text: Thank you Dr. Harris and all the staff for providing a personable and professional environment.

text: I had an emergency eye problem. I had never been to Eyecare Associates before but they worked me in quickly. The staff and Dr. Jackson were so nice and caring. Dr. Jackson spent time explaining the problem and treatment even though I was new and worked into his schedule. Very impressed.

resp.text: Melanie, we're so glad that we were able to go above and beyond your expectations! I hope your eye is doing well. I've passed your kind words along to Dr. Jackson and staff. We hope to see you again for routine care!

name: Williette Cooper-Peoples
text:
I'm sorry I got "lost" over the years due to moving, retiring and pop up eyecare places.
I will never do that again! I need to stay in touch with my"Good Doctor!" Dr. Jackson
See you all next year if nothing happens before then! 😘🥰😍

name: Cody H
text: Dr Harris was great! He was patient despite it being a very busy day and I really felt appreciated. I will definitely visit again for eye exams and I have already recommended him to my family.

name: Berniece Pierce
text:
I had my appointment on Wednesday, 10 July 2013. I normally see either Dr. Harris or Dr. Jackson. On this visit I was seen by Doctor Fredrick Jackson and it was a truly amazing experience. Everyone was extremely courteous and friendly. I was really impressed with Dr. Jackson on this occasion. He took his time explaining everything he was doing and why he was doing it. His explanations and genuine concern went a long way in putting my fears to rest. He not only took an interest in my eye health, but he was also very forthcoming with sharing some possible solutions to other areas of my overall health that could potentially affect my eye health. He offered some possible solutions to help with bouts of vertigo I have been experiencing for a couple of years now. He suggested some things that I could try to help to minimize the severity of the migraine headaches that I have been suffering for more than thirty years. No one else had ever made the suggestions to me that he did. I can't wait to put them into practice to see if they will help even the tiniest little bit. Thanks, Dr. Jackson, for one of the most enjoyable appointments I have ever had. And trust me, I will make sure that you are highly recommended to everyone that I know who needs a good optometrist. Keep up the good work.

Had my yearly exam on February 4, 2015 and must say that it was a very interesting experience. Even though the wait time was a few minutes past my appointment time, I clearly understand why. The doctors spend as much time as needed with each patient and I realize that I will get the same type of treatment when it is my turn. Also, Dr. Harris' staff are extremely kind, considerate, and compassionate. I just love Dr. Harris to death (no offense Dr. Jackson, I love you, too). Even though he informed me that I have cataracts, he took the time to explain all of my options and shared his experiences with his father's surgery. I left the office feeling very good and felt that Dr. Harris had provided me with all the information that I needed to make a decision. Once I made the decision, he even scheduled an appointment for me--talk about the personal touch approach. I would highly recommend Primary Eyecare Associates to anyone. As a matter of fact, my entire family uses Primary Eyecare Associates. So, if you are looking for a good eye care center and optometrist, give them a call, THEY ARE THE BEST I have ever used. KEEP DOING WHAT YOU ARE DOING.

name: Lenny Samford
text: Have been using them for years. Very professional and courteous staff. Dr. Jackson is always very patient and thorough. He takes time to explain everything to you. I highly recommend them.

name: DDB Pollard
text: Dr. Tim Harris is the best! The staff are all friendly and professional! I always leave feeling confident that I received the absolute best in vision care!!

name: Angela E
text: The office staff is very polite, friendly, and professional. Dr. Jackson is awesome.  He took care of all my eye care issues. He answered all my questions. His smile brighten  the room when he greet you during the office visit. I would to thank the Eye Care Associate staff for taking care of all my family's eye care needs whether routine or emergency care.

name: Rebecca Whitehead
text: Mandy brought me back to begin my exam and was exceptional-- Great personality and made my visit seem like not a Dr visit at all. I was nervous about having my eyes dilated but Mandy mentioned a new technology that takes a "picture/xray" instead of dilation. It's a $39 cost but I knew that was worth it!!   I really liked Dr Harris, too. He was friendly and knowledgeable. He tweaked my contact prescription and I'm seeing much better now!  I will definitely recommend your office.  Kudos to all the friendly staff.

name: Aaron Deem
text: I've been coming here for nearly 20 years and have never had a bad experience. I've seen both Dr, Jackson and Dr. Harris and am equally comfortable with both. If you're looking for knowledgeable, caring doctors with a friendly team surrounding them, this is the place for you! I HIGHLY recommend them! =D

text: I like Eyecare and they support me nicely.Dr and staffs are nicely to treat me.Eyecare Associates is good.Dr Jaction is very nice person.He explain my ratina problem smoothly.I appreciate.

name: SHEILAH TIBBS
text:
I have been a patient for over 20 years with Primary Eye Care.  Dr. Jackson and Dr. Harris as well as all the doctors are very educated in their field.  For years I suffered with Dry Eye and with the help of Dr. Jackson and the patient care I am given this issue has been greatly resolved. I also had Lasik Surgery around 10 years ago with excellent results.  And today I am still seeing 20/20, I have had no regression in my vision.

Dr. Jackson is a very caring doctor, he not only cares about your vision he cares about your overall health.  Your health and medications are very important part of his exam.

Dr. Harris is very caring as well concerning you overall health.  He has a free spirit and your vision and how well you see is extremely important.

I would not go anywhere else for mine or my family's eye care.
When I leave I know they as well as myself have been give the utmost care as possible. And an exam that surpasses all others.

I thank them greatly for their compassion and care I am given.

I also work for these doctors and I personally know and see first hand the care that our patients are given.  Your optical needs are as important as your eye exam.  If its not right they will do everything possible to make things right and see you are satisfied. Your Vision is their main Focus.

name: Lessie Walker
text: I've never had to feel nervous about the meds that dilate your eyes. The tech makes you feel like you are special and he/she displays professionalism. At the check-out desk, you are given the glasses purposed for dilation of the eyes. I really enjoyed my experience at Eye Care Associates.

name: Stacey Harrell
text: Dr. Harris and his staff are professional and courteous. They are very efficient and personable. With all the patients he works with, he still remembers who you are and makes you feel at ease.

text: Great eye care group.  The staff and doctors are very friendly and attentive to your needs.  Will definitely be utilizing them on an annual basis going forward.

Thank you Dr. Jackson for your extra amount of caution. Eyes cannot be replaced. Suzette West.

name: Caro Stanford
text: I have been going here at least 10 years for my eye care needs. The staff is always super sweet and nice. Today is the first time I had a bad experience. The Dr. that I had always seen was gone so I was seen by a Dr. Jackson. For the most part he was professional. Until I inquired about Lasik eye surgery. I'm 24 and was told I was a good candidate for the program but I am under the age requirement. But more importantly I was offended when he said and I'm paraphrasing "People your age usually can't afford it. And if so it's BC their grandparents pay for it". I was offended and felt that comment was unprofessional and uncalled for.

name: Carol Roberts
text: I've been going to Dr. Harris for over 20 years, since their office was on Atlanta Highway. Then they moved to Carmichael, which was fine. Then they moved way out past Thorington Road, which is a pain, but I still go there. I've always been happy with the service in their office. A couple of years ago it seems they were bought out by some company that requires them to over schedule people and causes some very long waits. My last two appointments have run nearly an hour late. But the doctors and staff are still very nice and we get good quality glasses there.

name: Rose Cottrell
text: I have been going to Dr. Jackson and Dr. Harris for years and I've had several surgeries done on my eyes, they are both very professional and very knowledgeable in their field. The staff is great also and yes I will continue to refer them.

text: Dr. Harris, Amanda and Patricia are The Best. They were extremely busy on my last visit, but they still took time to answer all of my questions and never made me feel rushed.  I saw one ophthalmologist for 25 years before he died a few years ago, and it's taken me 2 years to find another doctor with whom I have the same comfort level and confidence!

text:
I normally get my eyeexam/glasses from Walmart, but I missed my appointment due to work and was told it would be a month and a half before the next opening.

Luckily enough Eyecare Associates was close by and could see me in a week instead.  The staff was very kind and the doctor was very helpful.   Especially so to the point that he gave me a full explanation of the purpose for each test and what the results from each meant.  I was at ease when he showed me I had a small bleed in one of my eyes that he was sure was not a serious issue.  Comforting to know.

I had a particular style of glasses that was not in office, so the doctor's saleswoman worked with me to find the closest thing to it and ordered three choices for me to have sent to her to try on

Overall, I'm happy and will come again.

name: Aaron Lundy
text: Absolutely amazing! I cannot express in a simple review my appreciation for Dr. Salisbury and his team. Above and beyond are, in my opinion, accurate descriptors. Every visit to their office has been a pleasurable experience, even when my eyes aren’t doing the same. Feeling like my concerns are being listened to and not dismissed is a huge deal. It defines the difference between a Health Care Provider  and a doctor. I never got a feeling I was being rushed or pushed through the process. Even with the state of social and economic limitations, I was given the same amount of care and consideration as I was prior. To be quite honest I actually look forward to seeing and speaking with them. I can’t say enough about Dr. Salisbury and his amazing team. But I’m sure if you were wanting to know bad enough to read this review you have already scheduled your appointment. When you purchase a material possession, you want the best quality, highest tier available. Do the same for your vision. You can’t get any better than this.

name: Joyce Goodman
text: I had a YAG Capsuleotomy on both eyes to clear up grey, blurry vision from a sac that formed on the back of both of my cataract lens implants. The procedure took about five minutes for each eye on different days a week  apart. My vision is clearer with the results being immediate. Dr. Salisbury was professional and thorough. Two drops in each eye for numbing and dilation probably took as long as the procedure itself. I was able to easily drive myself to and from the procedure. I was in the clinic about two hours for each eye. I could not have dreamed of an easier eye "surgery". The staff was caring and professional and everyone took all the time I needed to answer my questions. I've never had an easier surgery. The whole team did a great job from start to finish. Thank you Dr. Drew Salisbury and staff. Great job!

Stay away from these drs.  Their staff and the drs will lie about your insurance coverage and even the drs schedules.  Medicare will pay for your EYLEA injections every 28 days. They insist it is 31 days.  With schedules that keep drs in this and that office, by the time he is back in the Callahan office five weeks has gone by.  The receptionist will lie about the dr not being in the office, so she can schedule the appointment five or even six weeks away.  This is so she doesn’t have to argue about the 28 days - knowing she will lose the insurance argument.
This is the most unprofessional, unscrupulous group of doctors I have ever come in contact with.
For the preservision of your eye sight, find somebody else, anybody else to treat you!

text: I have made 3 visits to his office and will not return.  Dr. Anz might be wonderful but I have decided that he does not work for me. I am an educated person, but I was treated that way. His only direct comment to me was "move your purse."

resp.text: Ms. Westbrook, thank you for taking time to review our practice. I'm extremely disappointed we failed to continue to meet your expectations and regret hearing your interaction with Dr. Anz during last appointment was not to our standard and caused you to feel this way. We truly care about our patients and want to learn from your experience so we as a TEAM, including Dr. Anz, can make improvements. Would you please send me an email with a good contact number so I can call you to discuss your experience in more detail and offer you a personal apology? If you'd like to talk Dr. Anz as well I know he will be disappointed as well to hear this and want to know how he can improve so we can accomplish a few things. My email is josh@medicalartseye.com or you can message me through our Facebook or Google business page. My direct office number is 334-321-9705 but I'm still deployed to EAMC helping with our Covid-19 response so email will be the quickest way for us to connect. We look forward to talking with you & greatly appreciate you helping us improve our delivery of care! -Josh (Manager)

name: Kenzi G
text:
I was referred to this clinic from an urgent care, and an appointment was made for me. I had a severe viral infection in my eyes, and as you can imagine, I was in pain and eager for relief. When I arrived for my scheduled appointment, I was told by the front desk staff that there was no appointment for me on file. I showed them my referral sheet with the doctor's name and appointment time. They continued to refuse me and tell me I had no appointment. The woman checking patients in was very kind and tried her best to help me in a difficult situation. The rest of their office staff was the epitome of unprofessional. Rude, refusing service to a person with an appointment. Yelling, rolling eyes, and snatching papers. My five year old knows better than to act that way. When I called the urgent care and confirmed that I did have an appointment, the Medical Arts Eye Clinic staff tried to cover their mistake by saying they'd been given the wrong name for the appointment, even though my medical records were sent in my name....
No apology offered. No kindness shown to a patient in severe pain. I will never go to this office again. I will find any other eye care provider in the county before I would let these rude people treat me ever again.

resp.text: Thank you for providing feedback on your experience.  I apologize we did not meet your expectations.  If you would be willing to discuss the details further with me I will give you a call today.  -Josh (Manager)
