text:
Investigated Lasik last year as a solution to getting my Distance vision back.  After doing some research on internet and word of mouth I visited Dr. Marc's office for initial check-up and felt so comfortable with everyone involved I went ahead and had Lasik performed on both eyes at once.
What a great experience from the immediate outcome to the follow-up care.
I'd recommend Dr. Marc's practice to anyone looking into Lasik.

name: Joey Mead
text: Fantastic staff and doctors!

name: T Lawley
text:
I am 26 years old and have had terrible vision my entire life. I always wanted to do lasik because contacts bothered my eyes and glasses provided no help with peripheral vision. I mentioned in passing to a family member that I was considering lasik and he referred me to Dr Michelson for a free consultation. I can honestly say from the first time I stepped into this practice that I genuinely felt that every employee cared about my concerns and my questions. Especially my lasik consultant Donna. Thanks Donna! I had lasik scheduled for 9:30 am. I arrived at 9:15 and within 5 minutes I was in the back getting started. After all of the final testing and surgery prep I was walked to the surgery suite and the procedure began. My wife recorded the entire surgery and from beginning to end was ten minutes. There was absolutely zero pain during any of it! It has now been 10 hours since the surgery and I can see better than ever before and I know it's only going to get better. I am amazed at how professional Dr. Michelson and his staff are. This has truly been a life changing experience. So thankful that I chose the best eye surgeon in the state to do my lasik. I wouldn't have trusted anyone else with my eyes! You guys are the best!
UPDATE
I had lasik on 8/25 and went in this morning 8/26 for post-op checkup. Before lasik I was legally blind. Now, less than 24 hours later my vision is 20/15 in both eyes! That is better than 20/20. I only wish I would have done it sooner! Thank you Dr. Michelson!

text: Normally I do not take the time write reviews..but the experience was terrible. I had made an appointment and had called to reschedule a couple days later. The lady who answered the phone was very rude and even when I had originally called she was also rude. She was starting to arguing with me that I didn’t even have an appointment?! It is really unfortunate that a business has someone rude like that answering the phones as that would be the first encounter people have with the business. I hoped this place would’ve been great, but their receptionist definitely made sure that was not the case. Canceled appointment with them and will most definitely be looking elsewhere!!

text:
Absolutely loved how quick the 3 receptionist sign you in and get you back for the visit to begin. Alexis was a very pleasant young lady. Quick, worked efficiently with no supervision. Dr Dunson was an absolute treat to meet. He goes through the process of explaining and even teaching you about your eyes.
The only only complaint I would have is the amount of frames to select from. I've never seen so few brands and selections to look at. This older lady was very very helpful and answered my questions. I will be back for another check up next year with Dr Dunson. I may have to shop frames around town if their selection isn't any better.

text: Years ago my local ophthalmologist told me that I had glaucoma and should see one more expert than he. Not only is Dr. Ball all of the above but is open to questions one might have about their condition or a procedures they might be facing and explains in terms that the person can understand. How often does one actually looked forward to a doctor's visit. Well, I do. Let's all hope that Dr. Ball will be around for many years to come .

I truly believe if I hadn't  found Dr. BALL I would be blind by now.

name: Kevin McGrath
text: Man of few words nonetheless very good.

name: JR H
text:
I would not describe DrBall as a people person, but he is an excellent technician and surgeon. He has at least for now saved my vision from glaucoma disease which he says is a serious condition for me. I have attempted to thank him for this several times now while in his exam room.

However, at one laser treatment at the nearby Surgicare center, I unexpectedly had severe pain from the treatment. When I stood up I think I was partially in shock. It was like wasps stinging my eye! The center was very busy that day and I suspected, just my guessing, that a long wait had caused the deadening drops in my eyes to wear off some. On the next scheduled treatment I asked him again about this to make sure I knew what was coming. His answer was more technical in nature and less about the fact that his patient had been hurting so much. The actual cause to me was not really the point. Much more important was to try to avoid such as this in the future, if possible. Perhaps it was unavoidable I don't know. He did not inform me. He said that at the earlier time that he had had to use a stronger laser strength setting. That is, my diagnosis of the pain cause was incorrect!  As if i really cared about my being right!  Whatever the causation, I would like to be warned about the possible discomfort and perhaps given more pain lessening drops?

On my very first surgery on my left eye for both cataracts and glaucoma, one of the nurses had accidentally left a sheet of plastic over my nose somehow. DrBall was asking me why I was  squirming so much while he was operating? I said because I cannot breathe. The nurse then removed the plastic, saying somewhat rudely I thought, something like, I hope you're satisfied now! I did not appreciate this attitude & comment for it was a real problem for me not being able to breathe, as it most certainly would have been for this nurse as well! The location of this again was at the Surgicare site of course.

But these problems pale in comparison to the help the doctor has given me.

( I would suggest for surveys expected to be done by eye doctor patients, that you make your display screen  characters in the survey larger and bolder so that I & others can read them better! I think the very best doctors, nurses, surveyors, and technicians are able to somehow put themselves in the position of the patient as if they were the patients.)

name: Esme' Waters
text: I brought my elderly mother in to order her glasses. The two women working were very nice but it was obvious the department was understaffed. They had a line of people waiting and some were getting impatient and even rude. The office was very hot like the air conditioning was broken. I felt sorry for them having to work under those circumstances. My mother is elderly and in poor health. She was very uncomfortable have to wait without any air-conditioning. As busy as this office appears to be I doubt it is having money problems so I highly suggest you adequately staff your office and fix your air conditioning. It just really looks like someone is being stingy and that's not a good look.

resp.text: Thank you for taking time to give feedback.  We will look into the areas of concern that you mentioned.

text:
They made my visit a quick and easy appointment. Once they checked my eyes, they let me pick out the frames that I liked and after a few days they called me in to pick up my glasses. Fantastic customer service through it all.
Edit: my name is Christopher Searcy if you would like to look up my name in the system (mainly for the owner)

name: Property Care & Maintenance
text:
Nobody to answer the phone,  your always waiting for the next available agent. The billing is part of company totally separate from the doctors and cannot provide any info unless you have a particular Dr. to deal with.
Then .... they cannot give you any information on insurance companies that the billing department will deal with.
I cannot imagine what would happen if you needed to contact some one for something you really needed.
Cannot complain about the people because I never got to talk to anyone other than in billing and they could not help me because I wanted to know about insurance ... which each doctor deals with separately.

resp.text: I apologize for your encounter at the front desk.  We’d like to hear more about what happened so we can improve.  Please call our office manager, Venessa, at 650-2020.

name: Madison H
text:
Doctor was 45 minutes late and incompetent. Both experiences were miserable, weird and unprofessional.

Late and unprofessional doctor/ staff, unsanitary and unmonitored Environment, not ran well generally.
Thankfully there are other eye care clinics in Mobile! (I would prefer to walk around constantly squinting and running into things than go to this “clinic” again.I have had several annoying, maybe even BIZARRE experiences here. During my first checkup I had the pleasure of watching a screaming old woman- WITH ONLY ONE SHOE ON-  hobbling after her child (?) with the OTHER SHOE IN HER HAND! If this somehow isn’t unsanitary it is at least alarming....! After dealing with the rude, impatient  ladies at the front desk, a nurse dilated my eyes and told me the doctor “would be right in.” 45 minutes later, My doctor (don’t remember name) casually walks in and performs what could have been an eye exam (?), only to tell me my RX is the same...I was late for my next appt. and was generally annoyed. The second time was through phone call- I just needed my lens RX  and although the lady seemed nice enough, she did not answer the first call and when I called again she told me she would send it through email “immediately, before she left”,one unanswered phone call and a week later I still have not received the email. Guess I will call a third time. Currently looking for another clinic.

resp.text: Would you please tell us why you left a bad review.  We’d like to know what we can do to improve our performance.  You can reach me at twhite@vp2020.com

name: Ron Bryan
text: I'll begin by saying that Dr. White is great and my family is sad to be leaving him. That being said, his office staff is rude and incompetent. Our insurance does not require referals for routine eye exams. The last time my daughter went, they billed it as a specialty eye exam, which does require a referal. Needless to say, insurance denied it and we received a bill. That took several hour on the phone and 5 months to get straightened out. Today, I called to schedule my wife for a routine eye exam and was told she needed a referal. I explained our insurance and was told that was their policy. I asked to speak to the office manager, was put on hold, and the same lady came back and said that she spoke to the office manager and that the office manager said, at this point, I interupted her and once again asked to speak to the office manager. She said sure and transferred me to voicemail. We will not be returning.

resp.text: Mr. Bryan, I am sorry to hear this.  I would try to resolve your issue myself, but I admit that insurance is not my specialty.  I would like to get our office manager involved with this.  What number can I have her call you at?  Again, I apologize for all of this.  Tim White.

name: John G
text: The wrong insurance was billed and after contacting the office twice the problem wasn't corrected after assurances that the mistake was their fault and would be corrected. We finally paid the bill out of pocket since they were threatening collection. Although the doctors are good the office staff will make us take future business elsewhere.

resp.text: I apologize for the frustration.  If you would, please email your info to me at twhite@vp2020.com   I would like to look into the situation for you.

text: First visit with Dr. White today. Very nice. The employees were helpful. Good selection and help with eyeglasses. A bit pricey on frames but who isnt.

resp.text: Thank you very much for your kind words!!  We appreciate you coming in.

name: Mary Rifley
text: I really like Dr. White and Dr. Mcgowin.  What I don't like is the difficulty getting through to the appointment desk as another reviewer complained about.  Non stop info about Vision Partners.  If only a real live person would say hello and tell me to hold please, I'd give them 5 stars.

resp.text: I apologize about the appointment line.  We will look into making approvements.  TBW

name: Eli Stephens
text: My 9 yr. old son was in the Mobile location on October 4, 2019.  He had picked out the black on black plastic Ray Ban frames.  The staff stated that it would take 2 weeks for his frames to come in so he had to go without glasses which contributed to him having major headaches.  They stated they would call me once they came in to come and pick them up.  I had to call them 3 separate times and physically go into the office and ask if they had come in yet for me to finally get my son's glasses, only to realize that they were the wrong frames.   He has been wearing the wrong frames for the last 3 weeks b/c he couldn't go a day longer without glasses due to his headaches. The staff there stated they would order the correct frames which should only take a week..... I have called the Mobile office 6 separate times (last call was Friday November 1, 2019)  with the response of, "I don't know what you’re talking about, can you repeat what is going on again?" and with "I don't see any frames for the name of ****** here for pick up"..... with no resolution.  I have drove up there 3 separate times, the last time being yesterday, November 4, 2019, and a member of the staff sat there and pulled my son's frames out of her desk drawer and stated, "well, they're right here"... with attitude and with a disgusted look on her face that clearly showed that she was bothered with having to even deal with the situation.  I then asked how long they have had the correct frames there because I NEVER received a phone call to advise me that they were there for pick up.  Their response was, " I don't know"...... They stated they needed the glasses off my son's face before they would give me the correct glasses for him to wear and attempted to take them off his face right there.  I told them they were not taking the glasses off of my son's face and we are leaving with his new glasses that we had paid for. They then stated i would have to call management to try to resolve the issue and they just sat there without giving me the name and number of the person I needed to talk to.  I had to ask them for that information directly.   Needless to say, I left the office yesterday, yet again, empty handed because they never gave me the glasses that we originally ordered and paid for.  I WILL NEVER GO BACK TO VISION PARTNERS AGAIN!!!!  The staff is the most unfriendly, difficult, incompetent, and rude group of people I have had to deal with.

resp.text:
I apologize for this situation!!  If you would, please email me your contact info and I will see what I can do.
Twhite@vp2020.com
Tim White

name: SUSAN CLINE
text: Dr. McGowin was friendly and professional.  She explained the cataract surgery to me and answered any questions I had.  She had a few tricks up her sleeve on how to figure out my dominant eye that I hadn't "seen" before, and it was pretty cool.  The other office staff was very pleasant too.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words.

name: Lizetth Moffett
text: I love this place, always clean, always friendly, & always pleasant.  W usually don't have to wait more than 10 minutes to get called back.  Nor do we have to wait long for the doctor to come in.  I would totally recommend this place. Doctor Vo is the best!!!

name: Amanda Jackson
text: It’s sad when the surgery is quicker then the appointments! The whole staff is slow no matter the time of day. Dr. Weaver is great, but somebody needs to teach these people that a check up appointment should not take 5 hours!!! (And that is not an extraggation.)

resp.text: We are sorry that you had to wait such an extraordinarily long time that day. We have been working to provide the same level of care, but in a more time efficient manner.

name: Janet Kennedy
text: Dr. Vo took a lot of time to listen to and discuss my particular needs, and was very thorough in discussing my options with me. I would highly recommend her.

resp.text: Janet, thank you!

name: Annie Johnson
text: I have gone here for years for my eyes I have glaucoma and I wouldn't want to go to no other place but vision partner they have the greatest doctors a place could have for your eye care try it and you would feel the same as I do.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words!!

name: keith hadden
text: I am completely confident entrusting my eye care to Dr. McGowin. She demonstrates an appropriate level of professionalism while showing genuine concern for patients. In addition, her support staff is also quite proficient and professional. Pleasant experience overall.

name: C Greer
text: Been dealing with an eye "allergy" for over a year. Last eye dr said it was allergies.  Dr Vo diagnosed me with "dry eye"   -  problem now solved and see great with the correct drops.  Thank you Dr Vo!!

resp.text: Thank you so much!!

name: jan sauer
text: Dr. Vo was a delightful surprise. She knows her stuff and was most helpful when I was stressed about my eye condition. I recommend her highly.

resp.text: Jan, thank you!

name: John Lee
text:
Doctor is very professional,kind and takes time to explain procedures and recovery instructions. She takes time to answer all questions and is very nice to talk to.  I would, without hesitation, necommend her to others.
Barbara Lee

name: Bill Hall
text: Dr McGowin was great. She explained the procedure in detail and provided multiple options. Thanks

name: FRED GOCHEY
text: In an emergency no-notice referral, Dr. Vo extracted both my eyes and replaced them with marbles. I can see clearly now!! She's amazing!

name: Elise Ritter
text: Love Dr. McGowan! Very professional and caring! The whole office is very professional and kind!

resp.text: Thank you Elise!

name: Brian Gay
text:
The eye exam experience should not be that difficult, but somehow they make it that way.

I have had the worst experience with all of the Vision Partner branches, but the one on Stanton Rd. took the cake. The staff was unbelievably rude and poorly trained. I went up to talk to the receptionist, she shooshed me, asked me if I didn't see her talking on the phone, and then closed the glass. I had an appointment at 9:30, but didn't get in until 11:00. When I did make it back to the office, they told me we would have to wait an hour and a half for my son's eyes to dilate. If this was the case, then why didn't they do that while we were already waiting. All in all, they expected me to be there for over 3 hours for an exam that might take 10 minutes.

The Daphne branch and Providence branches are just as bad. In Daphne, the doctors told me my eyes are getting better and I needed a weaker prescription. I asked them how was that possible since I have had glasses for 30 years and they stay pretty much the same or get maybe slightly worse. I thought that was just common sense, but I thought I could trust them. When I got my glasses back, they made my eyes cross. The staff told me that was because I needed a few days to adjust to the new prescription. After a few days, nothing. I took them back, got a new pair and the same thing happened again. It took them 3 tries before they could correct the problem.

Like I said, I have been wearing glasses for over 30 years, lived all around the US, and have never had a problem. Optometry is usually pretty simple, but for some reason these people make it really hard. My advice it to go somewhere else because anywhere would be better than these guys.

name: Michael Linder
text: Dr. McGowin is one of the most competent, thorough, and kind physicians I have ever seen. Her manner puts you at ease and she has a true healers touch.

name: Mike Dodd
text: Dr. Vo was very professional and great at her job! Highly recommend here!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words!

name: Vickie Summey
text: I would never get glasses at this place again !!!! They tell you that your glasses will be back in One two weeks but it’s more like six weeks . The two ladies at the desk are very rude and unprofessional!!!! WILL NEVER GO BACK

resp.text: I apologize that it took so long to get you glasses.  I would like to look into your situation and see what happened.  Please email me at twhite@vp2020.com

name: Linda Thornton
text: Dr. McGowan is great.  I have been using Vision Partners for years and highly recommend usng them.

name: Zsaquez Thomas
text: The visit was for my son and from the time we walked in the door the people were soo nice from Nikki at the front desk to Jordan doing the beginning of part of his exam and Dr. Vo it was great thanks

name: Robert Vincent
text: Explained things well, thorough.  Very pleasant and competent.

name: Lois Pote
text: Very organized - Friendly - Professional.  Makes my annual eye appointment a very pleasant easy experience.

name: Wanda Saunier
text: Have always been treated with utmost care for what was in my best interest. When my insurance changed & I no longer could use them they made sure I was sent to the best retina specialist in town. Now that my insurance has changed once again & I can't use the dr I have been seeing, I have been welcomed back warmly to this office. Even though I have had to reschedule due to unexpected events I have never been treated with anything but respect & concern. "Tom" who makes the appointments is very professional, knowledgeable, very good at people skills & at the same time very kind. I have no complaints with this place & those who make up the team.

name: Donna Wright-Lovelace
text:
I’ve been there twice in a week and my visits we’re very professional and the staff was very courteous.
I’m a retired surgical office nurse, first impression are very important.

resp.text: We are sorry that you had difficulties making an appointment. In the future, if you have trouble getting through, please call 251-650-1000 extension 101. That extension will get you through to the phone staff supervisor

text: Dr. Vo- Nguyen The sweetest, most caring in the building !!

name: Taylor Massey
text: Dr. Small was so helpful and informative. Loved her!

name: Yeon Chul Kim

text: Pick another vision provider. You'll be happy you did.

text: I called in to see was my son glasses in they told me no.  When I already been waiting almost 2 weeks .So I called and ask them Tuesday morning was my son glasses in they said no it will be 2 weeks to 3 weeks I said well I need my son glasses he need them for school I already waited 2 weeks. So I called them Tuesday morning ask was his glasses in they said no  .Ok they called me back less then 4 hours they your said glasses in I said wow ok I'm coming to pick them up. I get there they gave me the wrong glasses  that I didn't even order . So thing is they lied to get me out the way and gave my son some glasses that he didn't order now got to wait 2 more weeks not going happen I'm getting to the bottom of this . Please people never go to this place I don't preciate them doing this to my son and me!

name: Ree Salter

name: Cheryl Burton
text: Dr McGowin was super with my 80 year old Father in Law.

name: Joseph Amato
text: Professional and caring.

name: Travis Bragg Fishing
text: At least an hour wait every time I've been there, 2 hours once, but they expect you there 15 minutes before your appointment.

name: Nikole Hatton
text: Maynor & Mitchell is immediately kind and welcoming. Once I arrived for my appointment, they got me back immediately and did not make me wait throughout my entire time there. Everyone seems happy and friendly—nice atmosphere!

name: Steve Alewine
text: The staff was great and very friendly. Dr Mitchell was very good at answering all our questions.

name: Robert Trehern
text: The staff was amazing to provide the urgent medical attention I needed regarding an accidental eye injury. The Covid safety protocols in place kept me safe and well. Dr Salter diagnosed and treated me quickly, but with great care.Thanks to their care my eye healed within 36 hours. Thank you very much.

name: Sharon Bertels
text: Outstanding and very professional staff. Interacted with several members and all were extremely pleasant and helpful.  Dr Mitchell lives up to his outstanding reputation - total professional with superior knowledge who strives for perfection!

name: Freeman Allen
text:
This is the Best  Eye center to me in the State of Alabama.You wont find a friendlier staff n doctors anywhere if u need surgery on your eyes or a eye issue here is the right place to be from time u check in to time u check out best staff ever  Freeman Allen
Arab. Alabama.

name: Brenda Clark
text: Dr. Baxter and the whole staff were nice and answered all my questions. I would recommend them to anyone.

name: Tammy Pruitt
text:
Absolutely love Dr.  Vandiver. Which he sent me to Dr. Mitchell @ Maynor and Mitchell Eye Center.  Dr. Mitchell removed my cataracts in both eyes.  He is very professional with great ethics, my surgery was done and in appx 2 hours, and he sends you to lunch, then returned back at his office at 12:00(**that was my time, it may be different for other patients **) .  He likes to Ck and see the eye to make sure surgery went good and no complications.  I have been in glasses since I was 10 years old, with the cataracts removed from both eyes I am now seeing 20/10 and 20/15 in my eyes! I was so much the colors of things were so different, so vibrant and pretty.I no longer did not have halos, I realized they were only one thing I  was looking at, which was a good thing. I did not know what to think it took a minute for my brain to comprehend that I no longer needed glasses to see distance.
I will always have to wear glasses to read, but I am amazed at the quality of work and how How easy it was to have the surgery to see just how things look, how clear I could see things, without having to wear contacts or glasses not to mention developing and having cataracts.. I was told by my regular doctor;  Dr.  Vandiver in Athens, Having cataract surgery is almost 100% correction; where optional Lasix surgery to correct far vision is only temporary and Then you have to wear glasses or contacts or are to have Lasix to be re-done , usually in 10-20 years.  I was never able to afford having the Lasix surgery (because it is considered a cosmetic surgery) so I wore contacts and glasses all my life!  When I developed cataracts I did not understand why I could not see In my correction glasses/ contacts that I was used to wearing.  When Dr. Mitchell done my surgery, let me REMIND you it was in and out, within four hours I was seeing (almost ) perfect, I had very minimal swelling and the next day at my check up (Dr. Vandiver) My swelling was almost completely down, which even amazed my regular eye doctor. Dr. Vandiver , even helped me out with some really expensive eye drops by giving me a couple of samples( with my RX INSURANCE COST ME $70.00 out of pocket.) I found Dr. Mitchell to be very professional, caring, and very informative.  He is not one of the doctors that just does the work and then rushes you out of his office. He took his time, he done the job, and he made sure my eyes were healthy before he discharged me.  Dr.  Mitchell did NOT PROMISE ME THAT I WOULD BE ABLE TO GET TO A PERFECT EYE SIGHT……however, even though he did not promise he did tell me that he would do his best for me to see clearly, Now I can perfect better than perfect (in MY OPINION) I could not be any help happier!  I Highly, highly recommend
Dr. Mitchell’s service. He will take care of you no matter what your circumstances are!!
THANKS TO DR. MITCHELL NO MORE EXPENSIVE PROGRESSIVE LENSES OR EXPENSIVE CONTACTS, even if he did not promise that, he done a great job with the surgery, and my eyes are brighter, and healthier!…. I would do it all again 100 times over. Thank you Dr. Mitchell and  to your team!.

Mrs. Pruitt

name: Theresa Colbert
text: Appointment was at 10:30. It is now 11:47 and still have not seen the doctor. If you find you want to waist half your day sitting in a dark waiting room with horrible channel info-merials then this is the place to do so.

name: Dale Ayers
text: The Staff was efficient, followed COVID protocols very well. First time appointment with Dr Salter, I like his approach and is easy to talk to.

name: Wanda Robinson
text: Very pleased with their service. Prompt. Pleasant. Took time to answer my questions. Were definitely Covid aware.

name: Deanmu6uio Paulin
text:
I have had two appointments in the last year.
Both went very well. Wonderful and caring staff took great care of me. Easy in and out with my prescription. Dr Salter is very nice and knows what he is doing. Next appointment next year!

name: donna stiles
text: Dr Mitchell is fantastic! He diagnosed a condition that I had seen 3 other physicians for and had not gotten an answer. I have had cataract and laser surgery by him. I could not recommend him higher.

name: Erwin Gagnon
text: First class in every way,nurses, doctor, very clean and every thing was done on time.

name: Marilyn Davis
text: From the time we walked in the front door until we left we were greeted with.friendly smiles and cheerful attitudes.   Thank you so much for taking such wonderful care of me.

name: Nathan
text: Fast easy appointment set up for new patients, called on Wednesday had a appointment at 8 am Friday!  Day of appointment,  very fast and easy. All staff members were great! Highly recommend!

name: lee anne bostick
text: Dr. Martin is fabulous as is her staff. Very little wait and always professional. I highly recommend.

name: Ashley McClure
text: Very nice people, They get you in and out and they have a great bed side manner.

name: Anna Johnson
text: Could have not had a better experience working with Dr. Mitchell and his team in Huntsville. Communication, professionalism, and patience the staff portrayed really made the Lasik experience flawless! Highly recommend.

name: sue masters
text: They were great with my mom Mary Wharton. She was very happy with everyone from the time we walked in until we left. She said she wished her other appointments for her eye went just as nice.

name: Robert Parks
text: Received a thorough eye exam and an excellent professional assessment of current medical status of my eyesight and best advice for continuing in good health.

name: Michelle
text:
This place is FANTASTIC. My doctor is Dr. Salter. He recently saved me from blindness. Because of multiple health issues and drug allergies, I had to have eye surgery wide awake, with only local anesthetic. He was so GENTLE and compassionate... We got through both surgeries free of any complications.

His staff are some of the warmest loveliest people. I've dealt with all of them at one point or another - med refills, scheduling, on call on weekends - they're so fantastic.

Being chronically ill means you see LOTS of doctors. I've had some serious lemons. It makes me appreciate good care, which I assure you that you will get at Maynor and Mitchell.

Thank you again Doc -
M.B.

name: Lauren Adams
text: After years of wearing contacts I finally got up the courage to get LASIK surgery. Dr. Ramsey did my surgery last year and I couldn’t be happier with the results! Everyone who works in their office is super nice and made the surgery and the whole process so easy. I can’t recommend them enough. My only regret is that I didn’t have it done sooner.

name: Robert Fennie
text: My visit was very professional. The staff was very professional. I would recommend you to anyone.

name: Michael Cackowski
text: The business Maynor&Mitchell  does what it is suppose to do in regards to my condition, which to me rates a 3-Star.  I gave it an extra star because the Dr listened to what I wanted done during my visit.  I do not know all the possible services offered, so based on my experience they do their job!

name: Lee Fudge
text: Great staff explains the whole process. Doctors are extremely patient and answer and explain in detail. Results are wonderful!

name: Nancy Matlock
text: I recently had cataracts removed from both eyes. They have the nicest and friendly people working there. I felt like a real person not a number. They called on the Monday after my surgery to see how I was doing and if I had any questions. Dr. Mitchell was very nice and friendly. I felt comfortable with doing the surgery. I would recommend them for cataract removal.

name: William Moore
text: The facility was nice with ample parking and the interior was calm, quiet and somehow not too bright. From the first young lady who greeted me to the final one who wrapped up my appointment information, everyone had the perfect blend of personality and professionalism. I left with complete confidence!

name: Teresa Martin
text: My husband and I have been patients for over 12 years.  We have always had the best of care from the Doctors down to the receptionists.

name: Robert Satterwhite
text: Great place. All the people that work there are great. Professional attitude but fun. Doctors do a great job also. Been going there for several years and will keep going back.

name: Kathy Bryant
text: My experience with Maynor & Mitchell was wonderful. The nurses and technicians went above their duty to help me.  I was a little nervous and there was noting to be nervous about.  While I was in the waiting room, a lady from my church came out telling me how wonderful they were. She was right.  Thank you for helping me see better!

name: Kathy Saladino
text: Dr. Mitchell is fantastic!! Would definitely recommend him to anyone having eye problems.

name: Laura Teets
text: Dr. Mitchell did my lasik about 3 years ago and now I am seeing Dr. Martin for my annual eye care. I absolutely adore Dr. Mitchell's staff (especially Libby!) This has to be the busiest eye doctor's office I've ever seen...a testament to their quality if you ask me!

name: andrew ausin
text: My wife worked there and was unable to provide childcare due to the coronavirus. (Daycares were shut down) and she was given the option of no pay or to come in and work. So when you think about using this place, think about how they treat their employees who spend 40 hours a week there. Since she couldn’t provide a 2 weeks notice they also kept her earned time off pay as well.

name: Sharon Young
text:
Every time I come in the staff and Dr Martin is very pleasant and treat you with respect.  Great place to get your eyes checked.

Thank You.
Sharon Young

name: Jodi Rutenberg
text: Awesome care from caring staff and doctors!

name: Sarah Bonkoski
text: A year ago I had lasik surgery done by Dr. Ramsey so I wouldn't have to wear my glasses at my wedding. It was a wedding shower gift from my mom. (I'm allergic to contacts) and it has been the best thing I haves ever done (besides marrying my best friend)

name: Bill Whitmer
text: Dr. Martin and Dr. Ramsey are very knowledgeable and helpful. The staff is very friendly.

name: Magen Gilmore
text: Highly recommend! Dr. Salter made sure I was well informed and comfortable with my treatment plan. All of the staff were super nice too.

name: Doris Grisham
text: Best eye center for cataract surgery. Doctor Mitchell was great and explained everything in detail. I could not have gone to a better eye center.

name: Patrick D. McManus
text: Staff is caring, professional, courteous, and thorough. Dr. Maynor, as always, encouraging.

name: Brenda Lee Graham Eubanks
text: I was seen in a very timely manner at my last appointment. The staff all were very courteous and helpful. Dr. Martin is a wonderful ophthalmologist.

name: June Mckinney
text: Everyone is very nice very helpful and makes you feel at ease. The Establishment is very clean neat and you can feel comfortable and both the exam and surgery rooms. Dr. Mitchell is extremely personable and I feel very comfortable with anything he says or when he does any type of surgery on my eye s.

name: Lee Cooper
text: My wife & I went to Maynor & Mitchell yesterday for eye exams. My normal eye Dr charges only a $20 copay. I thought I would try this place to help me get back to wearing contacts, trying a different brand. My eye Dr told me that wouldn’t matter but it was worth a try. M&M up charged us and we had to pay $410 when we checked out. They should have informed me of all the extra charges when we got there so we could have left. Contacts are NOT at all that important. I should not have paid it. That was ridiculous. I will not return. I will not recommend them. Get your prices upfront if you go there!

name: Doris Holaway
text: Very pleasant staff and great doctor that seems to know his stuff. I would recommend Dr Ramsey

name: Tina Kilgo
text: Dr. Ramsey and his staff took the fear and worry out of this delicate procedure.  They were friendly, professional, and efficient. Amazing results!  Thank you all for the wonderful care you gave to My Sweetie.

name: Sandra Dover
text:
I was very pleased with the whole experience.  Was disappointed
when I learned that the vision I hoped would be available through insurance will be a unexpected expense.  I intend to have it anyway.

name: Leivy
text: Dr. Ramsey went ABOVE AND BEYOND for my father. I am beyond grateful for him and his staff!  My husband was also seen at this clinic a couple of years ago by another doctor and also received exceptional service. Highly recommended this clinic!

name: Judy Brewer
text: Great Drs and staff

name: Douglas Garcia
text: No complaint on service but kind of expensive for the time spent

name: Guy McKay
text:
Surgery 3-4 years ago, will never go back.  Cannot recommend.
Bad Cataracts, Really wanted Lasik.  They wanted the money.
They shouldn't have performed due to Fuchs' Dystropy.  Staff was rude.  I won't say they lied but stretched the truth about low interest financing. They also had a discount agreement with Dynetics which they didn't mention or even honor; oh you came in on the wrong side of the business. Yes, wish I hadn't come in. Almost $5000 later, I've never had the results they stated.  Now I may never get full use of one eye.  Still needed glasses. They only should have done cataract removal and lens replacement.  Buyer Beware.

name: Frances Akridge
text: I was referred here 12 years ago by the researchers at the Wilmer Eye Clinic in Birmingham. I have a great team of physicians in this practice.

name: Michael Johnson
text: I was Talked into paying thousands extra for Lasik and implants on top of my cataract surgery, have now lost 25% of my vision after 2 corrections. Then told they can't correct the problem detected by a later test. Be VERY careful of their promises.!!!!!!

name: Allison Moeller
text: I've only gone once and won't be back.  The appointment was pretty normal, but I had to wait 45 minutes and the place is huge - it's like a cattle call.    What clinched it though is the billing.  I don't have vision insurance, just BC/BS and got an eye checkup and glaucoma screening back in June 2017.  Paid my copay at the door, then... nothing.  Finally got a bill for $80 in February or March, then another for $49 JUNE 2018.  That is a pretty ridiculous timeframe, and it has not been my experience with past providers.

name: Virginia Elliott
text: Dr. Mitchell is the cream of the crop. He truly cares never being satisfied with anything less than perfect. The staff are friendly and helpful. Waiting time can vary but I don't mind waiting for a doctor who will give you the absolute best treatment.

name: Joey Rogers
text: I have gone to Maynor & Mitchell for a while.  I never know who my doctor is going to be there when I go.  I have had 4 so far.   If you have something like an eye infection, don't bother calling.  It will take a week to get in.  I complained about this one time and the Doctor told me to call and he would just prescribe medicine on the phone.  Tried that, they wouldn't do it, week to get in.   On just a normal checkup appointment, prepare for long waits.  They are not very good with scheduling.

name: Melissa McCullogh
text: Great place

name: Wayne Jones
text: Always a wonderful experience !!!!!
